heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 21 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.5°C), outside temperature (down 3.9°C), and inside temperature (down 2.5°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 698 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 51.4°C), feels like temperature (up 57.0°C), and outside temperature (up 54.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 697.8m lower than yesterday, 150.9m higher than the past week, 0.9m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1176m to a maximum of 4770m, averaging 1790.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1639.9m and 1789.8m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

pressure.description:
Today’s average pressure is 5.9 mbar higher than yesterday, 15.2 mbar higher than the past week, 1001.3 mbar higher than the past month.

The pressures yesterday fell between 1019 mbar minimum and 1033 mbar maximum, with an average of 1031.0 mbar; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1015.8 mbar and 29.7 mbar.
pressure.summary: Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and very bright daylight. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.
